Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Romania
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Romania 
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Some Questions in Understanding The Juche Philosophy" was published in booklet by the Datina Publishing House of Romania on June 16.
 The work, brought out on April 2, Juche 63 (1974), gives comprehensive answers to theoretical and practical questions arising in developing the Juche philosophy including the fundamental characteristics of the Juche philosophy, the Juche-based outlook on man, the Juche-based view of the world and scientific understanding of independence.    
 Written in the preface of the booklet are the words: "The Juche idea will be everlasting with the august name of its founder President Kim Il Sung by the outstanding ideological and theoretical activities of His Excellency Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people."

articles.title: Federations under KCTU Call Strike
articles.content:
Federations under KCTU Call Strike 
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Taxi Federation and the Federation of Metal Industry Trade Unions under the (south) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) respectively called strikes on June 16, according to MBC of south Korea.
 The organizations demanded improvement of the taxi operation system, labor-management agreement when coordinating the structure, guarantee of the minimum wages, etc.    
 Meanwhile, the KCTU declared June 16 day of the first all-out action and held large-scale meetings in Seoul and other major cities across south Korea.

DPRK Delegation to Six-party Talks Leaves
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation to Six-party Talks Leaves
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, left Pyongyang Monday to participate in the third round of the six-party talks on the nuclear issue between the DPRK and the U.S. to start in Beijing from June 23.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov and Minister-Councilor of the Chinese embassy here Guan Huabing.
